#labels Phase-Deploy,distribution
How to make a RubyTime distribution.

= Introduction =

To make any kind of distribution we use Tar2RubyScript and RubyScript2Exe. More you can find [http://www.erikveen.dds.nl/distributingrubyapplications/rails.html here].

= Prepare SQLite database =
Requirements:
  * Install sql-lite3 gem (1.1+).
{{{
>gem install sqlite3-ruby
}}}
  * Instll TCL Library (if Linux).
  * Download SQLite library (3.3.6+). SQLite library is available here: [http://www.sqlite.org/download.html http://www.sqlite.org/download.html]
  
Make DB:
  * Run:
{{{
>rake db:migrate
}}}
  * It should produce file {{{rubytime_development.db}}}. Copy this file to save place.


= Type of distributions =

===RBA archive (SQLite version)===
 * Go to directory {{{dist/}}} and execute script:
{{{
ruby dist.rb
}}}
 * It should produce {{{rubytime.rb}}} file.
 * Copy files {{{rubytime.rb}}} and {{{rubytime_development.db}}} to separate directory and pack it using zip and tar.gz.
 * Change names to: {{{RubyTime-v[VERSION]-rba-SQLite.zip}}} and {{{RubyTime-v[VERSION]-rba-SQLite.tar.gz}}}.
 * Remove {{{rubytime}}} dir.
 * voil√†!

===EXE distribution (SQLite version)===
  * If you want to make Windows executable, be sure that you're working under Windows.
  * Run script:
{{{
ruby rubyscript2exe.rb rubytime.rb
}}}  
  * Copy files {{{rubytime.exe}}}, {{{rubytime_development.db}}} and {{{readme.txt}}} from (dist/ directory) to separate directory and pack it using zip (file name {{{RubyTime-v[VERSION]-exe-SQLite.zip}}}).


===Packed application (MySQL version)===
  * Simply remove web-packages directory and pack using zip whole app directory.
  * Change file name to {{{RubyTime-v[VERSION].zip}}}
